channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban continue attacks on three major cities
item.description: Fears rise of a humanitarian crisis as Islamist militants seek to take their first provincial capital.

item.title: Turkey: Foreign tourists evacuated as wildfires threaten resorts
item.description: Coastguard vessels and private boats have brought holidaymakers to safety, as the death toll rises.

item.title: Myanmar: State of emergency extended with coup leader as PM
item.description: Gen Min Aung Hlaing takes on the new title and says emergency rule may last until August 2023.

item.title: Belarus Olympics: Krystsina Tsimanouskaya refusing to fly home
item.description: Krystsina Tsimanouskaya complained about team coaches after which she was taken to the airport.

item.title: Italy's Lamont Jacobs wins shock 100m gold
item.description: Italy's Lamont Marcell Jacobs claims a shock gold in the Olympic 100m final, after Great Britain's Zharnel Hughes is disqualified for a false start.

item.title: Simone Biles withdraws from floor final at Tokyo Olympics
item.description: American Simone Biles withdraws from the floor final but is yet to make a decision on whether to compete on beam.

item.title: Sky News Australia barred for week by YouTube over Covid misinformation
item.description: The digital giant bans the channel from uploading new content for a week over misinformation breaches.

item.title: New Zealand apologises for raids on Pacific people
item.description: Jacinda Ardern says Pacific Islander communities still "suffer and carry the scars" from the policy.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Valerie Adams makes history with fourth shot put medal
item.description: New Zealand's Valerie Adams becomes the first woman to win medals at four Olympics in a field event after claiming bronze in the women's shot put.

item.title: Israel accuses Iran over deadly oil tanker attack
item.description: The country's foreign minister blames "Iranian terrorism" for an attack that left two people dead.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Germany's Alexander Zverev cruises to men's singles gold
item.description: Number four seed Alexander Zverev produces a superb performance to win the men's singles gold medal at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Kris Wu: K-Pop star arrested on suspicion of rape
item.description: The Chinese-Canadian star denies allegations made online by several women in China.

item.title: Nairobi - the centre of East Africa's thriving arts scene
item.description: Artists from across East Africa have converged on Kenya's capital, creating a vibrant scene.

item.title: Mitholz - the tranquil Swiss village facing a time bomb
item.description: More than 60 years after a deadly explosion ruined Mitholz, the village remains under threat.

item.title: Elon Musk: 'I don't want to be CEO of anything'
item.description: Elon Musk reiterated on Friday that he doesn't want to be Space X or Tesla boss. What's going on?

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: The medal winners' flowers that pay tribute to 2011 disaster
item.description: More than 5,000 bouquets are being handed to athletes at the Olympic and Paralympic Games - and have a special significance, with flowers from areas devastated by a 2011 earthquake and tsunami.

item.title: Nigeria's kidnap crisis: 'I saw my two-year-old carried by a man with a gun'
item.description: Parents of schoolchildren abducted in Nigeria describe their trauma, and dilemma over the ransom demands.

item.title: India reptile park struggles to survive amid Covid
item.description: The future is uncertain for the thousands of snakes, lizards and crocodiles at the Guindy Snake Park.

item.title: China warns UK as carrier strike group approaches
item.description: A fleet of British ships is currently sailing through the South China Sea en route to Japan.

item.title: The women fighting infertility stigma in Nigeria
item.description: Three Nigerian women confront the prejudice they have faced on their fertility journeys.

item.title: ICYMI: Decoding feline feelings and a breathtaking bungee jump
item.description: A round-up of the week's news you might have missed.

item.title: The man who 'killed' Pluto
item.description: How Mike Brown’s discovery of a larger object threatened Pluto’s 75-year status as a planet

item.title: The separated refugees brought back together by judo
item.description: Sanda Aldass and Muna Dahouk have trained together since childhood but the war in Syria separated them.

item.title: Olympics: The hidden sight of Tokyo's homeless
item.description: For many among Tokyo's homeless community the Olympics are far from a cause for celebration.

item.title: Laurel Hubbard: The reluctant history-maker at the centre of sport's transgender debate
item.description: Weightlifter Laurel Hubbard is set to become the first openly transgender athlete to compete in a different gender category to that which they were born at an Olympics.

item.title: French boxer stages ring sit protest after loss
item.description: Frenchman Mourad Aliev refuses to live the ring in the aftermath of his controversial loss to Great Britain's Frazer Clarke.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Charlotte Worthington wins BMX freestyle gold for Great Britain
item.description: Great Britain's Charlotte Worthington wins a thrilling gold in the women's BMX park freestyle Olympic final.

item.title: Simone Biles criticism baffles Callum Skinner: Mental health 'not death of sport'
item.description: Criticism of Simone Biles for withdrawing from some events at Tokyo 2020 is "baffling", says Olympic gold medallist Callum Skinner.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Armand Duplantis glad to have avoided coffee with Sam Kendricks
item.description: Armand Duplantis is glad that a phone call from his girlfriend meant he missed a coffee with Sam Kendricks before the American's positive Covid test.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Medal table - which country has won most golds?
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table? How are Great Britain getting on? Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.
